summary: This is a search and seizure warrant issued by the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York, authorizing the forensic review of electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein and his properties. The warrant seeks evidence related to sex trafficking, transportation of minors, enticement, and conspiracy, specifically naming Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and Sarah Kellen as co-conspirators.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the investigation; electronic devices seized from him and his properties are to be searched for evidence of sex trafficking and related offenses.

persons.name: Sarah Kellen
persons.context: Specifically named in the warrant as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein; evidence concerning her identity, location, and communications is sought.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Specifically named in the warrant as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein; evidence concerning her identity, location, and communications is sought.

persons.name: Gabriel W. Gorenstein
persons.context: The judge who signed and issued the search and seizure warrant.

connections.description: Both are named as co-conspirators in the warrant regarding violations of sex trafficking and related offenses.

events.title: Seizure of devices from Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Law enforcement seized 2 electronic devices from Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Seizure of devices from 9 East 71st Street
events.description: Law enforcement seized 33 electronic devices from the New York City property at 9 East 71st Street.

events.title: Seizure of devices from Little Saint James
events.description: Law enforcement seized 27 electronic devices from the property Little Saint James in the Virgin Islands.

events.title: Warrant issued for forensic review
events.description: U.S. Magistrate Judge Gabriel W. Gorenstein issued a search and seizure warrant authorizing the forensic review of the seized electronic devices.

keyFacts: The warrant authorizes the search of 62 total electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein and his properties in New York and the Virgin Islands.
Sarah Kellen and Ghislaine Maxwell are explicitly named as co-conspirators of Jeffrey Epstein in the warrant.
The search seeks evidence for violations including sex trafficking of minors (18 U.S.C. 1591), transportation of minors (2422), enticement to travel (2423), and conspiracy (371).
The warrant authorizes a search for evidence from 1994 through August 8, 2019, indicating a broad temporal scope of the investigation.
Specific items sought include communications among co-conspirators, financial records, travel documents, and sexually suggestive photographs of teenage girls.
